p: Alkaloids comprise the largest group of nitrogen compounds, characterized by containing one or more nitrogen atoms within a heterocyclic ring. Over 12,000 compounds are known to be provided by a variety of sources such as animals, bacteria, plants, and fungi [ 24, 25]. Figure 1 presents the chemical structure of some well-known alkaloids, such as nicotine (1), morphine (2), and caffeine (3). Nitrogen, oxygen, carbon, and hydrogen are the chemical elements that constitute its basic formula, so that its molecular weight varies between 100 and 900 g mol −1. This class of compounds has revealed to be one of the most promising secondary metabolites for ALS treatment due to their diverse mechanism of action, which can collaborate to prevent the disease evolution [ 26– 28].
